{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3734377,"name":"Brody Anderson","username":"flamekeeper","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/flamekeeper/{size}/267435_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-08T23:41:47.462Z","cooked":"

I’ve been messing with addressable LEDs this off-season, and I while I’m sure everyone has experimented with fading a solid rainbow or a fading RGB pattern, I want to know what’s the coolest pattern you’ve personally made or seen? Has there been any bot designs that you think were made a lot better by LEDs?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T01:02:05.563Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":21,"reads":597,"readers_count":596,"score":239.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Brody Anderson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74592,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/1","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3734474,"name":"Ian Bae","username":"soriiku17","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/soriiku17/{size}/211323_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T01:27:47.749Z","cooked":"

694 has consistently used LEDs on the side of the robot to let the drive team know what state the robot is in (such as scoring, neutral, etc) and has proved to be extremely useful.

i do also really like the LED panel on the side of bomb squads robot this year. while i dont believe it is functional, it provides quite a bit to the aesthetic

20250418-_DSC92501920×2880 774 KB

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T01:27:47.749Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":577,"readers_count":576,"score":445.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Ian Bae","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":17}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63388,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"weeeeeeeee"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/2","custom_user_title":"weeeeeeeee","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":16},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":17,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734503,"name":"Ken Pontbriant","username":"electroken","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/electroken/{size}/160387_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T01:57:45.943Z","cooked":"

I’m biased when it comes to this subject but the ghost animation on the sides of our 2018 robot were the best we’ve had. If we were red, Blinky was displayed. If we were blue, Inky was displayed (actually a darker version of Inky), and while disabled, Clyde was displayed. When the robot was climbing, the ghost looked up.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T01:57:45.943Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":554,"readers_count":553,"score":425.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Ken Pontbriant","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":21}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17612,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 230 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/3","custom_user_title":"FRC 230 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":21}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":21,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734585,"name":"","username":"FinIce","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/finice/{size}/270519_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T03:38:01.727Z","cooked":"

ukiQ1t1533×800 125 KB

LED in tube is always great, 3414 did it on both 2024 and 2025.

For 2025, the LEDs were split into two sides, each with two strands in series (one for the purple base, one for the inside tube). We did have some fun modes with this robot, including a “disco ball” mode when climbed, flashing rainbow. It was removed because we had different density LED strips that broke the code.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T03:38:01.727Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":542,"readers_count":541,"score":228.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52870,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amateur Historian?"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/4","custom_user_title":"Amateur Historian?","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734696,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T04:34:57.973Z","cooked":"
Team 3574's Big Bling Board running on the Beaglebone Black Programming
That’s right, 6 pairs of safety glasses in a row, BBBBBB. http://i.imgur.com/WjwnlmE.jpg There’s 9 1024 RGB LEDs, each individually addressable, for a 96x96 display (QQQVGA, probably). What’s in it: 9 32x32 RGB panels 2 9A 5v Pololu Voltage regulators 1 Beaglebone Black 1 LEDscape octoscroller shield 1 2A 5v white box regulator The panels can be found at Adafruit and Sparkfun. The shield was made by OSHpark. On the BBB side of things, we can play any properly scaled video that FFMpeg can …
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T04:34:57.973Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":522,"readers_count":521,"score":104.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/team-3574s-big-bling-board-running-on-the-beaglebone-black/143128","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Team 3574's Big Bling Board running on the Beaglebone Black","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734702,"name":"Levi","username":"nobody5690","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nobody5690/{size}/203585_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T05:35:40.060Z","cooked":"
Fun (legal) Robot Decorations General Forum
That’s awesome! I’m a huge fan of LED matrix animations. Our bot would get “angry” when it would have to climb for example: [IMG_1033-2-ezgif.com-crop]

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T05:37:29.992Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":510,"readers_count":509,"score":197.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Levi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/fun-legal-robot-decorations/497143/45","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Fun (legal) Robot Decorations","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49892,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5690AM | https://lumynlabs.com"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/6","custom_user_title":"5690AM | https://lumynlabs.com","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734728,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T10:49:30.343Z","cooked":"

Cool!

We have a student working on a more, uh, capitalist, idea: What if we replaced our boring static sponsor polycarb sheet with an LED matrix?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T10:49:30.343Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":487,"readers_count":486,"score":317.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49892,"username":"nobody5690","name":"Levi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nobody5690/{size}/203585_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":14}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/7","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":14}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":14,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734891,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T15:55:14.220Z","cooked":"

Off topic a bit… But it is the off season.

Those trucks should be illegal on the road.

That does raise the question though, how much motion/ changeable LEDs is too much on a robot? At a certain point it may be very distracting for your (or other) drivers…

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T15:56:33.895Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":438,"readers_count":437,"score":207.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/8","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734892,"name":"Isaac Proctor","username":"Isaac-The-Pro","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isaac-the-pro/{size}/265401_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T15:58:25.910Z","cooked":"

6443 2024 looked really cool

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T15:58:25.910Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":428,"readers_count":427,"score":85.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Isaac Proctor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"Regular","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6352 Scouting/Design Lead"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/9","custom_user_title":"6352 Scouting/Design Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734898,"name":"Brody Anderson","username":"flamekeeper","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/flamekeeper/{size}/267435_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T16:06:34.217Z","cooked":"

IMO that limit is when it comes to the actual arrays, I’m not quite certain if there’s anything you gain using an array of lights over a strand or two in a visible position. Possibly requiring diffusers as well? I’m not on the drive team so I’m not sure how distracting moving patters on single strands would be, but I think the changing glare would be the biggest issue with LEDs during comps. Where would you draw the line?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T16:06:34.217Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":430,"readers_count":429,"score":101.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Brody Anderson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74592,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/10","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3734932,"name":"Hsifeulbhsifder","username":"Hsifeulbhsifder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hsifeulbhsifder/{size}/7991_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T16:49:52.325Z","cooked":"

7558 has tried making fun and informative LEDs over the last few years that both are mesmerizing and convey important information. In 2025 we had a bunch of visual states for different scoring levels, current game piece information, signals of completed actions:

We had cop lights for when we had to play defense:

In 2024, we had a full matrix that we used to convey the entire state of the robot, including auto/teleop clocks. With this, we were able to use our LED matrix in place of having a driverstation dashboard. Here’s a slowmo:

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T16:49:52.325Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":426,"readers_count":425,"score":330.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"Hsifeulbhsifder","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L9TTNYbkFnU","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":1},{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ceFNcLzsH9o","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24270,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7558 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/11","custom_user_title":"7558 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3735044,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-09T18:28:29.908Z","cooked":"
Skyehawk:

hat does raise the question though, how much motion/ changeable LEDs is too much on a robot? At a certain point it may be very distracting for your (or other) drivers

Yeah, I suspect “sponsor mode” will be limited to non-comp time as we will still want the LEDs for robot state during matches.

6328 in 2023 robot Banana Split had some awesome lights:

Since 16 was on our field, I did actually get a chance to ask about the LEDs, and I believe that the panels did react to the state of the robot giving them some function. I could see it not being functional considering it’s harder to see in comparison to a large LED strip, but still cool.
(if there is a 16 member/mentor wants to expand please do!)

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-09-09T19:16:50.462Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":36,"reads":367,"readers_count":366,"score":333.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506109,"topic_slug":"whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63388,"username":"soriiku17","name":"Ian Bae","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/soriiku17/{size}/211323_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65476,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"patrick | cascade crusader"},"post_url":"/t/whats-the-coolest-led-patterns-placements-youve-seen/506109/15","custom_user_title":"patrick | cascade crusader","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3737030,"name":"Malakhi Rivera","username":"malakhi","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-12T00:50:03.911Z","cooked":"

Hello, Team 16 alumni from 2025 here. While our LEDs looked tailored towards aesthetic, we built them with functionality in mind. Some examples were states of our robot. Our two fish and coral pattern displayed when the robot was disabled, the one-fish, two-fish, red-fish, and blue-fish (Dr. Suess) pattern displayed whenever our robot was in auto, and finally the stormy sea pattern displayed whenever our robot was in teleop. We also had patterns that played when our robot was in different states during a match. Some examples are when sensors are tripped, when our elevator was fully extended, whenever the auto-align was within a certain bounds, and many more. I hope this helps.

If we are talking bomb squad.

I always liked 16’s 2017 LED flames. I suppose it could have communicated something, but I just think it looks cool. It is really shown off in the reveal vid.

The Blue Alliance

Bomb Squad - Team 16 (2017)

FIRST Robotics Competition team from Mountain Home, Arkansas, USA.
